text: [Music]
I think the biggest misconception that
the Americans may have about the Middle
East is that uh most middle easterners
and most um Muslims or Iranians or Arabs
are terrorists or that they hate
Americans and you know they favor
violence over peace I think that that's
not true I think you have extreme
elements but I think uh most people you
know would like to just um get on with
their lives and uh don't really hate
American citizens they um they resent
the American foreign policy in the
Middle East I think the question uh of
the Palestinians is um you know a
priority for most middle easterners more
so perhaps than the Americans realize um
and I think that um you know Iraq and
what's happened in Iraq has also
contributed to um uneasy feelings about
the US and and what could happen another
remarkable thing that's happening in the
Middle East is that the Middle East is a
very young um region you know most of
these uh countries in in Iran in Saudi
Arabia in Egypt you know over 50% of the
population are under 30 years old um and
they're much more uh interested in
opening up to the rest of the world to
um you know live having democracy to
having um you know um more freedom and
reforms
